page.title: 02Principal Features(contd.).
page.content: This has been seen most recently in allowing the Water Authority and the Gas Board to lay new pipes through the forest.(The Army also uses the forest for training).This co_operation extends to the Research Centre which has been experimenting in growth using different kinds of Slurry. Part of the forest was destroyed eighteen months ago by gale_force winds of between 80 and 100 miles an hour.The uprooted trees were sold to a contractor who then cleared that part of the forest. The furrows are turned over by machine and the seedlings(which are grown in a Nursery area from the trees' own seeds) are planted, by hand, on the top of the furrows. The wood from the mature trees is used for paper, furniture, telegragh poles and pit props.
